text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Nintendo 64DD is a peripheral of the N64 released in Japan on December 1, 1999. It connects via the expansion port located under the console and allows it to read magnetic discs. A modem also made it possible to connect to the Randnet network which offered various options such as online gaming, a messaging service and Internet browsing. The 64DD increases console memory from 4MB to 8MB, and also offers the ability to run expansions for classic N64 games like Zelda or F-Zero X.
